pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.5: 59. The training rule on going to the instruction
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.2: At that time the nuns did not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.3: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.4: “How can the nuns not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns don’t do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.8: “… How can the nuns not do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1: ‘Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction. If she goes beyond a half-month, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.7: If she thinks, “I won’t enquire about the observance day, nor ask for the instruction,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.10: if she searches for a companion nun, but does not find one;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.14: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.15: The ninth training rule is finished.
